title: Transfer news: Inter Milan warn Arsenal, Chelsea and Liverpool off top target Ivan Perisic | Metro News
text:
Louis Sealey for Metro.co.uk Monday 20 Feb 2017 9:17 am Ivan Perisic has emerged as a target for a host of clubs (Picture: Getty) 
Inter Milan have told a host of Premier League clubs that star winger Ivan Perisic will not be sold in the summer. 
London rivals Chelsea and Arsenal and Jurgen Klopp’s Liverpool have all been linked with a move for the Croatian, who joined Inter in 2015. Theo Walcott left red-faced as Arsenal fans slam club for 'disrespectful' gesture 
But Inter sporting director Piero Ausilio insists Perisic is a key part of the club’s long-term project and won’t be leaving for the foreseeable future. 
‘I do not think it is either Perisic’s or our intentions for him to leave,’ he said. 
‘He is part of a massive project and we do not want to sell our players. Chelsea fixtures 
Swansea (H) – Sat 25 Feb West Ham (A) – Mon 6 Mar Watford (H) – Mon 13 Mar Stoke (A) – Sat 18 Mar Crystal Palace (H) – Sat 1 Apr Manchester City (H) – Wed 5 Apr Bournemouth (A) – Sat 8 Apr Manchester United (A) – Sat 15 Apr 
‘We cannot envisage an Inter without Perisic. We are not going to get rid of our best players.’ 
Perisic, who has made over 50 appearances for Croatia, is enjoying a productive campaign in Serie A, scoring eight goals for fourth-placed Inter.
